[quote]To what extent do you believe Church and State should be separated?[quote]
 
 The "separation of church and state" within the US does not exist in our constitution. The constitution was written tosay that the government shall make no law abridging the freedom of religion or establishing a religion. 
 
 The intention was to keep government out of religion. There was no intention to keep religion out of government. Had that been the case the constituion would have read "none of the three branches of government may entertain religious ideals from any faction." The constitution was very clearly written in a one sided fashion. It was meant to protect peoples religious freedom, not the government from religion.
 
 No the government should not invest itself in the machinations of religion. However, religious entities, of all faiths, (including christian by the way) have much to contribute to the governmental processes. 
 
 I think had an actual "separation" been the intent this country would have not lasted long.

Actually no, seperation of religion from influencing government WAS what was meant, rather than government influencing religion.
